intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion leucomalanides, commonly known as the white-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a pale center. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
